stream_context.summary: Live design session focused on the new Oil-Rig level: tweaking visuals (fog, lights), laying out platforms, placing entrances to an underwater hub, and—most of the stream—brain-storming its mid-game boss, ultimately settling on an "Oil Blarg" that Mario cleans with a rideable bar of soap. Smaller side topics: remaking early retro areas, polishing pass on older assets, broken cannon reticle after recent engine refactor, and general project progress.
level: Brief look at un-started Bowser “Magic Show” easter-egg

development_findings.summary: A polishing phase has begun to revisit older areas whose scope or quality no longer matches the rest of the hack.
development_findings.quote: I have recently made the decision that we're gonna remake some of the old retro areas because they're much smaller than the rest of the retro areas.

development_findings.summary: Visual updates: new blue fog and updated lighting pass implemented for the Oil-Rig level.
development_findings.quote: Today I decided to update the fog and I think this looks a lot better.

development_findings.summary: Oil-Rig layout now includes: main scaffold path, Bowser’s office tower, strike-area platform, multiple underwater-access pipes, and a power-generator shaft.
Four+ underwater entrances will form a connected sub-hub—possibly used as a quasi fast-travel network and for hiding two Yoshi Coins and the 8-bit pipe.
development_findings.quote: If we add entrances to go into the underwater area all over the place… that would add a lot.

development_findings.summary: Boss concept locked in: a giant oil Blarg built from Yoshi’s Island lore. Mario rides a soap bar to shrink/clean it across 2-3 hits; fight begins after a platform lowers into an oil pool.
development_findings.quote: Every now and then a soap bar spawns. If you’re on the soap bar you can chase him… when you hit him he shrinks and eventually he’s so small that he just dies.

development_findings.summary: Soap mechanic will also appear in main level as optional minigame (cleaning surface oil for a Yoshi Coin/blue coins) so players learn controls before boss.
Bowser’s office changed from full castle façade to single, tall tower with horned roof—better performance, clearer silhouette, lets players see interior Easter eggs from crane.
development_findings.quote: I’ve also had the thought that it kind of sucks that this is another Bowser castle… I think I’m gonna go with that suggestion and just have it be a big tower.

development_findings.summary: Cannon camera/reticle broken after updating libultra translation-matrix code; Kaze plans complete rewrite of reticle rendering.
development_findings.quote: I kind of updated all the lib ultra things… and broke the old reticle… I’m just gonna remake that whole cannon reticle anyway.

development_findings.summary: Current project status: roughly two-thirds of the game built; engine heavy-lifting done; still ‘at least a year and a half’ from release because Kaze has a full-time job.
development_findings.quote: We are only two-thirds through the game and it’s been like almost three years now… realistically it’s still gonna be at least like a year and a half.

development_findings.summary: Open-source release planned post-launch, partly to reduce Nintendo risk.
development_findings.quote: I will open-source this once it is released but not before because I would just be leaking my entire mod.

context_findings.summary: Kaze works full-time as an Unreal programmer at Gears for Breakfast; Return to YI is strictly free-time labor.
context_findings.quote: I do have a full-time job… I am a programmer at Gears for Breakfast.

context_findings.summary: Productivity philosophy: rely on discipline over motivation.
context_findings.quote: You need to work without motivation… You’re physically capable of working so why aren’t you?

context_findings.summary: Stance toward Nintendo legal: previously contested takedowns and won; now less worried though still cautious (e.g., delaying source release).
context_findings.quote: Last time they took me down I told them to fuck off… I’m not really that worried about Nintendo anymore.

context_findings.summary: Expresses dislike of corporate excess (Elon Musk rant) and distrust of ultra-wealth.
context_findings.quote: At some point when you have so much money… you cease to become human anymore.

context_findings.summary: Personal work–life note: married to Zeina, leaving stream early to attend double birthday party—shows balancing dev time with life.
context_findings.quote: We have to go to a birthday party… and I still have to shower because I’m not a stinky.

biobak.summary: Reviews and beautifies Kaze’s models; suggested horned roof and tower silhouette for Bowser’s office; proposed level-wide oil outline visual trick.
biobak.quote: My couch a lot with the models… whenever I finish a model he’s looking over it again it makes it a lot prettier.

biobak.summary: Pitched ‘Oozing Oil Operation’ as level name and various boss/visual ideas.

zeina.summary: Provides character animations; asked whether further Bowser animations were needed and offered to work on NPC sets.
zeina.quote: Is there any more Bowser animations you need or can I send these off and work on the NPCs?

zeina.summary: Acts as sounding board during stream, offers design feedback (e.g., on boss fight, castle size), casual banter shows comfortable personal/professional overlap.

key_stories.title: Finding the Oil-Rig Boss
key_stories.summary: The team needed a strike-breaking boss that fit the oil-rig theme. After rejecting robot pipes and generic Koopa ideas, chat and Kaze converge on an oil version of Yoshi’s Island Blarg. They craft a soap-based cleaning mechanic and an arena that sinks into an oil pool.
key_stories.challenge: Design a memorable boss appropriate to Bowser’s oil-rig and Yoshi’s Island homage.
key_stories.process: Brain-stormed enemy roster live; weighed mechanical requirements (work with Mario’s move-set, avoid new shooting mechanics); iterated through chat suggestions; defined attacks, arena transitions, and soap vehicle.
key_stories.outcome: Concept locked: giant Oil Blarg shrunk/defeated by Mario riding soap; mechanic will be tutorialized in level proper.
key_stories.key_quote: Every now and then a soap bar spawns. If you’re on the soap bar you can chase him… when you hit him he shrinks and eventually he’s so small that he just dies.

key_stories.title: Castle to Tower Pivot
key_stories.summary: Initially Bowser’s office was another full castle. Performance concerns and lack of unique gameplay led Kaze—nudged by Biobak—to redesign it as a tall industrial tower whose interior holds Easter eggs and strike negotiations.
key_stories.challenge: A castle façade felt repetitive and performance-heavy.
key_stories.process: Discussed platform distances, camera views, interior usage; Biobak mocked alternative; Kaze evaluated silhouette, scale, loading costs.
key_stories.outcome: Swapped to slim horn-topped tower placed centrally on rig, freeing space and reducing draw calls.
key_stories.key_quote: I’ve also had the thought that it kind of sucks that this is another Bowser castle… I’m gonna have it be a big tower.

key_stories.title: Contesting Nintendo Takedowns
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s channel previously received copyright strikes. He formally contested and succeeded, shaping his current risk strategy (no pre-release source code, cautious distribution).
key_stories.challenge: Nintendo copyright claims threatened visibility and continuity of the project and channel.
key_stories.process: Filed counter-claims, maintained public stance, adjusted release tactics.
key_stories.outcome: Videos reinstated; Kaze now feels cautiously confident, plans to open-source only post-launch.
key_stories.key_quote: Last time they took me down I told them to fuck off… I’m not really that worried about Nintendo anymore.
